steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook diced onion and garlic until softened, about 7-9 minutes
Add aji amarillo paste and oregano, cooking 2-3 minutes longer until fragrant
Pulse half the beans in a food processor until roughly mashed (or mash by hand with a fork)
Add all beans (mashed and whole) and rice to the skillet with the onion mixture
Mix thoroughly until well combined. Season with salt and black pepper to taste
Shape mixture into oval patties resembling small footballs (makes 4-6 patties)
Heat 1-2 tablespoons oil in a clean non-stick skillet over medium heat
Cook patties 3-4 minutes per side without moving them until golden and crispy, flipping once
Serve hot with salsa criolla on top
title: Tacu Tacu
